chapter.title: Adding signing keys
chapter.para: The KIWI image build process uses the distribution package management system to install the specified packages into the unpacked image tree that forms the basis for the target image. Installation of these packages requires KIWI to import the GPG keys from the build system to the target system. This allows signature verification of the package signatures, but also implies that repositories used to build the image are also know on the build host. Using a repository for image building if that signing key is not in the build system key ring will break the image build. After the unpacked image tree is created and the package installation is complete the GPG keys are removed from from the key ring of the image root system.
In order to permanently import the package signing keys into your appliance follow the steps outlined below:

listitem.para: Add the package containing the build key to the packages section
Call the import KIWI helper function in the config.sh script

chapter.para: If the image is built with these settings KIWI installs the package containing the keys and imports them permanently to the rpm keyring.
